series: How to engage in cyber policy
tagline: Videos on different aspects of cyber policy - human rights, cybersecurity, regulatory frameworks and cyber capacity building - with a final regional module highlighting how these apply in Africa, Asia and Latin America.
desc:
This series aims to help human rights defenders develop the tools, 
skills and knowledge they need to engage effectively in cyber policy 
debates. 

The series is structured around five modules. The first
 four each focus on a different aspect of cyber policy - human rights, 
cybersecurity, regulatory frameworks and cyber capacity building - with a
 final regional module highlighting how these apply in Africa, Asia and 
Latin America.

title: Prepare
tagline: In Prepare, we will take the first steps towards adopting an organised approach to our security as human rights defenders.

title: Explore
tagline: In Explore, we will detail a number of tools which are useful for carrying out context analysis from a security perspective. These tools help us to accurately identify the threats we face, and strategies and plans to prevent or respond to them.

title: Strategise
tagline: In Strategise, we look at how to develop and refine our security strategies, plans and tactics based on the threats identified in Section II | Explore.

title: Act
tagline: In Act, we identify some skills, best practices and resources which can help to increase our security during particular activities which are common in human rights work. The first mini-guide looks at exercising the Right to Freedom of Assembly, particularly with regard to protests and demonstrations.

title: Living Under Digital Surveillance: Human Rights Defender Perceptions and Experiences
tagline: What is digital surveillance? How government surveillance will affect activists?

title: Intro
tagline: Provide preliminary support for people facing the most common types of digital threats. Including self-diagnostic tools and guidelines.
desc: The Digital First Aid Kit aims to provide preliminary support for people facing the most common types of digital threats. The Kit offers a set of self-diagnostic tools for human rights defenders, bloggers, activists and journalists facing attacks themselves, as well as providing guidelines for digital first responders to assist a person under threat.
publisher: Digital Defenders Partnership
